page.title: 18Leigh on Mendip main street.
page.content: The older children of Leigh on Mendip school went for a walk through the village. We started from the east end opposite our school. Down a road to the left is the old 16th century vicarage and an Elizabethan farmhouse. Opposite the school is a derelict sawmill. It used to make handles for spades and other hand tools. On the north side, next to St Gile's church, are some modernised cottages that used to be used by pilgrims to Glastonbury . Most of the houses are on the south of the road and many were originally two or three small cottages. At the west end of the village is the post office and stores. There is one other grocery shop. There are four farms in the village.
